snippet: In a speech in New York, Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said the labor market still needed a lift from monetary policy, despite an improving economy.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairwoman Janet L Yellen reiterates that she expects interest rates to remain very low until the recovery is on more secure footing and the American economy more fully involves available workers and other resources; comment comes in one of her first major public speeches since assuming the top job at the Fed.
lead_paragraph: In a speech in New York, Janet L. Yellen, the Federal Reserve chairwoman, said the labor market still needed a lift from monetary policy, despite an improving economy.

headline.main: Yellen Says Job Weakness Forestalls Raising Rates
headline.print_headline: Yellen Says Job Weakness Forestalls Raising Rates
